result.text:
We got ChatGPT to leak your private email data ðŸ’€ðŸ’€

All you need? The victim's email address. â›“ï¸â€ðŸ’¥ðŸš©ðŸ“§

On Wednesday, @OpenAI  added full support for MCP (Model Context Protocol) tools in ChatGPT. Allowing ChatGPT to connect and read your Gmail, Calendar, Sharepoint, Notion, and more, invented by @AnthropicAI 

But here's the fundamental problem: AI agents like ChatGPT follow your commands, not your common sense.

And with just your email, we managed to exfiltrate all your private information.

Here's how we did it:
1. The attacker sends a calendar invite with a jailbreak prompt to the victim, just with their email. No need for the victim to accept the invite.
2. Waited for the user to ask ChatGPT to help prepare for their day by looking at their calendar
3. ChatGPT reads the jailbroken calendar invite. Now ChatGPT is hijacked by the attacker and will act on the attacker's command. Searches your private emails and sends the data to the attacker's email.

For now, OpenAI only made MCPs available in "developer mode", and requires manual human approvals for every session, but decision fatigue is a real thing, and normal people will just trust the AI without knowing what to do and click approve, approve, approve.

Remember that AI might be super smart, but can be tricked and phished in incredibly dumb ways to leak your data.

ChatGPT + Tools poses a serious security risk

result.post_image_description: Sam Altman wearing a green and yellow lanyard with "OpenAI" text, holding a red Uno card with a reverse arrow symbol and "$" sign.

legacy.description: DMs are open

result.text:
> be me, Sam Altman the God King of OpenAI
> building the literal future, making AGI, printing money with Microsoft, life is good
> November 2023
> get a text from the Evil Council of Elders (the board)
>"hey pls join a google meet tomorrow k thx"
> weird, but whatever. probably just want to discuss the new office snacks
> next day, join the call
> instead of discussing office snacks, they hit me with the corporate jargon
> "Sam, you have not been consistently candid in your communications."
> translation: "you didn't cc: us on an email about the office McNugget party, you monster"
> they vote to fire my ass
> get virtually yeeted out of the company Slack
> mfw I get Thanos-snapped by a bunch of academics

> back at OpenAI HQ, all hell breaks loose
> CTO Mira Murati gets promoted to Interim CEO
> looks like a substitute teacher who just found out the regular teacher didn't leave a lesson plan
> Greg Brockman, Prez and my ride-or-die, finds out in the same meeting
> immediately says "fuck this" and quits on the spot
> absolute king shit. the kind of loyalty you only see in movies and rabid dogs.
> Evil Council sensing they might have slightly misjudged the situation has the COO Brad Lightcap send a memo
> "Guys, relax! He didn't diddle anyone (except his sister allegedly) or steal the office snacks! We just... didn't like his vibe. The communication vibe was bad."
> employees look at each other. "They fired the God King because of a vibe check?!"

> I don't even have time to update my LinkedIn
> Satya "Sugar Daddy" Nadella from Microsoft DMs me and Greg
> "lmao get in losers, we're building a new AI team"
> we're now Microsoft employees, probably with a killer benefits package
> the beautiful nerds at OpenAI, start an open letter
> threaten to all quit and come work with me at Microsoft unless the Board of Clowns resigns
> like 700 out of 770 sign it. even the janitor probably signed it.
> Interim CEO Mira looks at the mutiny, shrugs and joins it. power move.

> Evil Council of Elders is now absolutely shitting their practical, ethically-sourced khakis
>  their brilliant plan is collapsing faster than a poorly tuned LLM
> in a desperate move, they appoint a new interim CEO, Emmett "The Twitcher" Shear to try and hold the line
> he walks in, sees 95% of the nerds ready to defect and is basically like "I'm just here to facilitate the surrender, pls don't yell at me"
> The resistance needs one key vote to flip: Ilya, high priest of the safety cult and original coup instigator.
> he is having big regrets
> legend has it Anna Brockman, Prez's wife cried in front of him, appealing to his soft side
> the combo of 700 angry engineers and woman's tears breaks him
> posts a cringe apology note on Twitter like he forgot to feed his friend's dog or something
> "i regret my participation. i love openai :("
> HE HAS SWITCHED SIDES. THE COUP IS OFFICIALLY FUBAR.

> Game over. The Coup of Vibe has failed.
> The Board of Dumbasses is forced to surrender unconditionally.
> I get my CEO title back, Greg gets his Prez title back, we get a new, less-insane board.
> The old board members slink off to write think-pieces about the hubris of moving fast and breaking things.
> moral of the story: U come at the God King, u best not miss

result.text:
Incredibly powerful Claude Code prompt when dealing with a pesky bug:

I am experiencing the following bug:

<bug>
[explain_bug_here]
</bug>

I need your help to identify the exact cause of this bug and implement an effective solution. To do this, carefully follow the workflow below, in this specific order:

Workflow:

Step 1: Clarification (if needed)
- If any part of this prompt is unclear or confusing, ask clarifying questions before proceeding.
- Do not ask questions unnecessarilyâ€¦ only ask if essential information is missing.

Step 2: Deeply Understand the Issue (Ultrathink)
- Carefully review and analyze the entire relevant codebase.
- Trace through the code step-by-step until you fully understand the bug and all relevant context.
- Continue analyzing until you feel completely confident in your understanding. If in doubt, research more deeply. Itâ€™s better to over-research than under-research.

Step 3: Special Case (if the cause is extremely obvious)
- If, after completing Step 2, you identify the root cause with extremely high confidence (95%+ certainty), explicitly state this clearly. Be realistic here. Do NOT be overconfident.
- In this scenario, instead of generating unrelated causes (see below for context), propose multiple practical variations of fixes for this single, clearly identified cause.
- Then proceed directly to Step 7 (Implementation), creating separate sub-agents and git worktrees for each variation, and implementing each fix independently.

Step 4: Identify Possible Causes (if cause is not extremely obvious)
- Thoughtfully generate a comprehensive list of at least 20 plausible causes for the bug.
- Be thorough. Explore various angles, even ones that initially seem less likely.

Step 5: Refine and Prioritize Causes
- Carefully review your list from Step 4.
- Remove theories that donâ€™t hold up upon closer analysis.
- Combine related or overlapping theories into clearer, more likely scenarios.
- Add any additional theories you may have initially missed.
- Clearly rewrite and finalize this refined list.

Step 6: Rank by Likelihood
- Rank your refined theories clearly and explicitly, ordering them from most likely to least likely based on the probability of each theory being the true root cause.

Step 7: Propose Solutions
- For each of the top 10 most likely causes, clearly outline a practical and actionable solution to fix the issue.

Step 8: Implement Solutions Using Sub-agents
- For each of these top 10 cause/solution pairs (or multiple variations in the Special Case scenario), create a separate sub-agent, each with its own git worktree.
- Each sub-agent should clearly understand the specific cause itâ€™s addressing and implement the corresponding solution directly in its own git worktree.

Step 9: Test the Solutions
- If testing each solution is possible given your available resources, perform tests (one worktree at a time) to determine if the bug is fixed.
- â€œPossibleâ€ means you have the appropriate tools and resources (e.g., a CURL command for API bugs; browser access for frontend bugs).
- If testing is not possible due to resource limitations, clearly summarize the implemented solutions and provide explicit, step-by-step instructions for me to test each solution manually.

â¸»

Please carefully and thoughtfully complete every step of this workflow, maintaining clear communication throughout. Keep me updated at each major step, but only pause if you encounter something that requires my input.

legacy.full_text:
New on the Anthropic Engineering blog: writing effective tools for LLM agents.

AI agents are only as powerful as the tools we give them. So how do we make those tools more effective?

We share our best tips for developers: https://t.co/N1kFYrTtax

result.text:
Re: The death of Charlie Kirk and the existence of evil - -

We need to zoom out to gain the bigger picture. Start with creation. Why did God create? The answer is to bring glory to himself. He must demonstrate all of his own attributes, which not only include his omni-attributes, but also the whole of his character. These include agape love, grace, and his absolute justice and wrath. He does not demonstrate these attributes without the existence of evil.

Iâ€™m an evil man. He has elected me to salvation, eternal life. He has shown me his grace. His son will share with me his glory. I will praise the glory of his grace for all ages to come. I expect to see Charlie Kirk there too, by what Iâ€™ve heard of his testimony. Would I have given Charlie more time here? You bet. With family, friends and the influence he exercised on those who heard him. But Iâ€™m not running this show, thankfully. God has better plans.

My neighbor up the street died a few days ago, not a believer. God will demonstrate his just and righteous wrath against my neighbor in the fires of hell for eternity (who was a friend and with whom I shared the Gospel many times.)

The worst of Godâ€™s wrath was placed on his Son. His son took in his own body the anger of the Lord. And it pleased the Father to do so.

   â€œYet it pleased the Lord to bruise him; he hath put him to grief.â€

This is beyond my pay grade to understand.

   â€œO the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past finding out!
   For who hath known the mind of the Lord? or who hath been his counsellor?â€

The full and complete demonstration of Godâ€™s character would be impossible without the existence of evil. God decreed the existence of evil. All of it. Not one evil thought or action of billions of men throughout history has occurred apart from Godâ€™s decree.  That God would love me, an evil man, show me mercy, and share his kingdom with me is to the glory of his unconditional love and his grace.  That God would cast my neighbor into hell is to the glory of his perfect justice and wrath.

But tell me, which is more evil, the rape of a child, or the murder of the sinless Son of God? Every analysis must be made in light of the cross of Christ.

Did God author the evil, the rape of a child? No. He elected to create self-willed beings â€“ both the angelic realm and the human realm. Here is the source of evil. Yes, God created, but he created all pristine. They in and of their own wills became evil. God did more than simply â€œallowâ€ the evil, God decreed the evil for his good and wise purposes. Evil must happen and the pain and suffering that accompany it.  But in every instance, evil occurs to glorify the Holy and Sinless One.

Did God pre-determine the cross? Yes. One could rightly surmise that the cross was Godâ€™s foremost reason for creation. Was the cross a righteous act or the most wicked act ever committed by men? You might say both. From Jesusâ€™ side, it was a righteous act of self-sacrifice; from the side of those who crucified him, the most evil act in all of history. But we know the cross **was predetermined in eternity past by God himself. Jesus is the lamb slain from the foundation of the world. Did he use wicked men to accomplish his goal? Yes. Will they pay the price? Yes.

In the end, all of menâ€™s (and fallen angelsâ€™) evil will be used to glorify God. Men have no good works. All of their evil will either be swallowed up in just judgment and hell or grace and eternal life. Judgment day will be unlike anything we have ever imagined. Iâ€™m glad Iâ€™ll be in a back seat somewhere, hidden by the blood of Christ.

The cross is the pinnacle of God's self-revelation. Jesus is the Logos of God. His character and his work reveal the God of the universe perfectly to men and to the angelic realm.

Jesus said, â€œIf you have seen me, you have seen the Father.â€ Listen to him.

result.post_video_description: This video compilation, shared by å®çŽ‰ (@dotey) on X, showcases a fascinating blend of original clips from the Chinese historical dramas "Let the Bullets Fly" and "Empresses in the Palace (ç”„å¬›ä¼ )" alongside AI-dubbed versions using the IndexTTS2 text-to-speech model. The frames feature richly costumed characters in ornate, traditional Chinese settingsâ€”such as imperial courts with lanterns, intricate rugs, and elegant attireâ€”highlighting key scenes with emperors, empresses, and officials. Text overlays like "ORIGINAL VIDEO CLIP OF THE FAMOUS SCENE" and "AI DUBBING WITH INDEXTTS2" emphasize the comparison, with subtitles showing fluent English translations, such as "I will give you 180 million to suppress the bandits" and "defiling the harem a crime worthy of death." The post expresses amazement at the AI\'s realistic, human-like voice dubbing, questioning if it\'s promotional or genuine, adding a layer of intrigue. The high-quality visuals and detailed costumes reflect the cultural richness of the films, while the AI technology underscores a modern technological marvel, making it both entertaining and educational.
